intro: Adinandra angustata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed adinandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, including countries like Nigeria and Cameroon. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow and are clustered in small inflorescences. Adinandra angustata is often found in forest understories and is adapted to low-light conditions.
